com.mkarasz.hw5.playTone

Class MIDI

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mkarasz.hw5.playTone.MIDI

  • public class MIDI
extends java.lang.Object
    Implements (simply) a MIDI note and its length.
    Author:
    Matt

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MIDI()
      Sets the MIDI to the default stuff, as seen in default helper method below.
      MIDI(double frequency, com.mkarasz.hw5.playTone.NoteValue noteValue)
      Sets the frequency of the note, and then the length
      MIDI(int midiNumber, com.mkarasz.hw5.playTone.NoteValue noteValue)
      Sets the MIDI number of the note and its length
      MIDI(java.lang.String note, com.mkarasz.hw5.playTone.NoteValue noteValue)
      Parses out the string note and sets the length

      • setOctave

        public void setOctave(int octave)
        lets you set the octave of the note. Doesn't affect where it is in the scale.
        Parameters:
        octave - the octave the note should take

      • getOctave

        public int getOctave()
        Gets you the octave of the current note.
        Returns:
        the octave from -1 to 9

      • setSharp

        public void setSharp()
        Sets the note to sharp if it can be, else prints error and does nothing.
